title: Science Journey: How Soil Microbes Help Us Fight Climate Change - www.caltech.edu
text: Science Journey: How Soil Microbes Help Us Fight Climate Change Thursday, April 11, 2024 10:00am to 11:00am [Add to Cal](webcal://www.caltech.edu/campus-life-events/calendar/science-journey-microbes-climate-change-hannah-dion-kirschner?ical) [Beckman Auditorium](/map/campus/beckman-auditorium) Hannah Dion-Kirschner, Caltech graduate student, Geobiology, - Public Event Teachers, parents, community members: Learn about tiny organisms called microbes that live in the soil and what designing science experiments has in common with practicing a musical instrument in this presentation by Caltech graduate student Hannah Dion-Kirschner. This in-person STEM field trip is free, but reservations are required. [▶︎ REGISTER TODAY](https://caltechlive.wufoo.com/forms/caltech-science-journeys-registration-4112024/) About the Series [Science Journeys](https://events.caltech.edu/series/science-journeys?utm_medium=web&utm_campaign=science-journeys&utm_source=caltechcalendar&utm_content=&utm_term=), Caltech graduate students and postdoctoral scholars explore a range of scientific topics that will spark students' curiosity and provide educators with supplemental resources to continue exploration in the classroom. [Friends of Beckman Auditorium](https://events.caltech.edu/support/fob?utm_medium=web&utm_campaign=science-journeys&utm_source=caltechcalendar&utm_content=&utm_term=). For more information, please contact Mary Herrera by email at
